comments.body: A cool situation that could come out of this could be two villagers competing for resources, leaving the player having to figure out how to take down the rival village, so their village can thrive. You can burn down and kill the residents, but if there's a reputation mechanic, an overt offense like that could have penalties, encouraging the player to think more tactically.
They're not melee attacking you, you're just getting burned by touching them because they're made of fire.

https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/community/posts/360076252651/comments/360014057051

Blazes don't have contact damage, they have a standard attack speed
Herobrine
The entity 303 and herobrine never existed, so just stop kid.

This is a small, but logical feature that I would like to be added to Minecraft because let's say you were riding on a boat. This boat would travel on an ice/other ice variant bridge. Suddenly, you see a hoglin in front of you that gets picked up by your boat. You then get attacked from behind and get knocked into the lava. This feature will prevent that from happening.
Add some ideas of some other rare itemsüòä.

Are these rare items macguffins (items the player can't use), or are they supposed to be functional?
Either way would be good, just good to clarify programming difficulty.

And where did cursed wood come into this?
I dont know was that part was random. But about the item. I think they be good as mcguffins cause we aint got alot in mc. A few could be functional.
I love this idea but I just want to add something, I think it would be better if instead of being able to barter with them you could just trade like you do with villagers.
That one is really good, seeing as Illagers are basically just rejected villagers. Also, villagers are always in that passive state
OMG vote for this right now Minecraft players we need this

All they need to do is mix tangos teas mod with vanilla minecraft, make the villagers be able to terraform and build and the villagers being able to run entire on there own like in those kingdom mobile games.
I am pretty sure this is not what Mojang wants to do with the Piglin Brute
I think that is a great idea except maybe it should also need to be enchanted with a certain enchantment.
Good idea

Great idea,

Charcoal and coal have the same smelting time, have mostly the same texture, just charcoal is easier to access, as you can just smelt logs to obtain it. But other than that, it's really the same thing.

So why won't villagers accept it? There's no reason why not to.
I Vote for this it's a very good idea
I also thought about it, but why can only the villagers of taige can do it. It should be that all villagers can do that

Villager BS, it would not make sense for all villages to be able to do that because of the following; 1.Snow golems are hurt by rain. 2.Snow golems require snow so it is reasonable to assume only villages with easy access to snow would construct them. 3.Last but not least, in the real world and to a lesser extent the game snow melts where it is warm. It might work for all villages if they added seasons and could actually pair rather well with such an addition, but otherwise it would simply not make sense as a feature for all villages.
I agree but why will illusioner drop milk bucket?
@Ping Bong the illusioner would have a milk bucket to cure status effects like its own blindness

I like it. though I think he should still have 16 hearts, still more than any other humanoid illager so far, and only spawn on the final 4 waves on bad-omen 4-6, not just hard mode. I also think evokers should still drop the totem of undying, maybe he could drop something else, "The Book Of Illusions"? actually, I might post something like that.

Edit:

maybe with the teleport ability if you get too close, then a puff of smoke will appear, the illusioner will chuckle and disappear, and appear else where.
Definitely, also hoglins should drop a unique food.
They should do this in the Hoglin Stable version of the Bastion Remnant.

I'd prefer sheeplings to have some small structures to live in and hide so piglins can't easily commit genocide; however, befriending these creatures then witnessing them being murdered would remind the player that the Nether is not a nice place. They should also be fearful of every living thing that poses the slightest bit of danger, making players have to gain their trust by crouching towards them and dropping valuable tools and ETC as gifts.
Perhaps these sheep could hold piglins back with soul torches? This would add a use for the torch, as it could be given to the sheeplings to befriend them?

Sheeplings should drop some type of mutton that can only be cooked in a soul campfire. There are only two ways to get food in the nether so it would be cool if they did drop mutton. They should also be a little hard to find so that is would be rare to get food in the nether.
They could even try to bother the player by following him around

Villagers traded mending before 1.14, and at the time it was not overpowered. It's the new trading mechanics that made it overpowered, so I don't think removing mending from villager trading is the best solution.

They should give you better books based on popularity instead of lowering their prices imo. Mending villagers used to be valuable before 1.14 but with the new mechanics, they're literally so common. Another way to change it would be to increase the price of rare books to be much higher.
I don't think it should be removed but I think the enchantments they offer need to keep their rarity. High level enchantments should not have the same chance to be offered as low level ones.

What is wrong with keeping the armor you worked so hard to obtain?  I think a better option would be to cap the XP cost increase on the anvil to double the cost of the first repair.  That way it still has a significant cost, but it is manageable.
Takes a lot of work to put together a trading hall, and to get the mending price lowered. I think mending should stay as is, because all of the work that is put into it should be allowed to succeed.

I couldn‚Äôt agree more. Balance is so important for keeping effort and reward equally. Not only has it become very easy to get a mending villager. But also the trades have become more unbalanced. Why should I bother to trade fish or coal when I can get 1 emerald for 1 stone or a mending book for 3 emeralds+book?  I think a mending book should be at least 48 emeralds worth. Sometimes prices rise a little but quickly drop again. I suggest setting the value of items to a more fixed value. For example 32 Stone = 8 coal = 6 fish = 4 leather = 1 emerald. And if the same items are sold in high quantity‚Äôs raise the price for a longer period of time so players are motivated to trade a larger variety of items with different villagers.

Mending is a treasure enchantment and shouldn‚Äôt be available through trading just like soul speed and swift sneak. i also think frost walker and the curses shouldn‚Äôt be available there ether. Also it isn‚Äôt balanced in the slightest all you have to do is plant sugar cane and trade for a mending book which usually costs around 10-15. And you can just keep replacing the book stand thing till you get the trade
Maybe not all trades, but just the first trade to make mending not obtainable with trade cycling.
why is mending even considered a tresure enchantment when you can trade it from villagers
With the Trade Rebalance, hopefully Mending is limited to Swamp Villagers.
Having a villager related to the golem building process would be very interesting.
